title: Bring back Content Refund for Major Gameplay Updates
body:
Back in the day, if a champion got a major gameplay update you could apply for a refund of all of that champion's skins. This was intended for champion mains and players with off-meta builds that relied on their pre-existing skillset. Unfortunately, players caught on and started using gameplay updates as an opportunity to get some free RP from content that they don't use very much. With so many people using it, and for the wrong reasons, Riot decided to stop allowing content refunds for all players - a blanket ban.

Fast-forward to now. Fizz was my most-played Champion across all of my accounts in Season 6. I used a weird AP Bruiser Fizz build with Rylai's and Gunblade. It wasn't meta, but it worked for me and it helped me climb. It also does not work (full stop) with the new Fizz.

I sent in a ticket to Riot asking for a content refund. I acknowledged that I knew why Riot no longer allowed them, but explained that I fit the criteria for players that should actually still be able to get content refunds for gameplay updates.

They basically just told me to go away because there was nothing they could do.

PLEASE RIOT. Let players actually affected by VGUs to be able to get content refunds. I refuse to play Fizz in his current state. He's about as gimmicky as Shaco, and scales worse than him.
